item.title: EVO Japan 2025 title lineup announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/evo-japan-2025-title-lineup-announced

Five one-on-one titles, and two five-on-five titles.

The Evolution Championship Series has announced the official title lineup for EVO Japan 2025, which will run from May 9 to 11, 2025 at Tokyo Big Sight in Odaiba, Tokyo, Japan.

The full lineup of titles is as follows:

  • One-on-One
    • Granblue Fantsy Versus: Rising (Arc System Works / Cygames)
    • Guilty Gear: Strive (Arc System Works)
    • The King of Fighters XV (SNK)
    • Street Fighter 6 (Capcom)
    • Tekken 8 (Bandai Namco)
  • Five-on-Five
    • Street Fighter III 3rd Strike: Fight for the Future (Capcom)
    • Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. (SEGA)

Ticket sales and registration are open now until April 7, 2025 at 11:59 JST via the EVO Japan website. Users who purchase tickets by January 27 will receive an early bird discount.

item.title: Game Boy â Nintendo Switch Online adds Donkey Kong Land III
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/game-boy-nintendo-switch-online-adds-donkey-kong-land-iii

  • Switch

Dixie Kong and Kiddy Kong's adventure through 36 stages.

Following the addition of Donkey Kong Land and Donkey Kong Land 2, the Game Boy â Nintendo Switch Online app has added Donkey Kong Land III, Nintendo announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via the back of its box:

About

Fame-and-fortune seekers have flooded Donkey Kong Country in search of the fabled, Lost World. You command Dixie Kong and Kiddy Kong through 36 Kong-sized levels of action and adventure. Use your animal friendsâSquitter the spider, Squawks the parrot, Ellie the elephant, Enguarde the swordfish, and Parry the parallel birdâto help you prove your adventuring skills and find the Lost World before someone else does!

Key Features

  • 36 Kremling-infested levels!
  • Play as Dixie Kong or Kiddy Kong!
  • Five different animal friends!
  • Secret areas and bonus levels galore!
  • Battery-backed memory saves three game files!

Watch a trailer below.

December 2024 Game Updates

English

Japanese

item.title: XDefiant to end service on June 3, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/xdefiant-to-end-service-on-june-3-2025

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Ubisoft San Francisco and Ubisoft Osaka reportedly closing down.

Publisher Ubisoft and developer Ubisoft San Francisco will delist free-to-play multiplayer first-person shooter XDefiant starting today and shut down servers on June 3, 2025, the companies announced. Existing players will still be able to continue playing and access upcoming content until the servers close.

Game Fileâs Stephen Totilo is also reporting that both Ubisoft San Francisco and Ubisoft Osaka are shutting down, with up to 277 staff to be laid off. Half of the XDefiant will be moved to other projects.

XDefiant first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC on May 21.

Here is the full message from XDefiant executive producer Mark Rubin on the gameâs end of service:

Hello XDefiant fans,

I am unfortunately here today to announce that XDefiant will be shutting down.

Starting today (December 3, 2024), new downloads and player registrations will no longer be available. We will still release our Season 3 content in the near future (exact date to be determined) and the servers will remain active until June 3, 2025.

For those who purchased the Ultimate Founderâs Pack, youâll receive a full refund. Players who made any purchases within the last 30 days will also be fully refunded. Those refunds should happen automatically within 8 weeks of today and you can find more details on our official website, XDefiant.com.

A few years ago, Ubisoft and the [San Francisco] development team embarked on a bold adventure to develop a new arcade shooter called XDefiant. It was from the start, an incredible challenge. Not only were we trying to shake up the genre by removing Skill-Based Matchmaking while bringing back a more âold-schoolâ arcade shooter experience, but we were also diving into the high-risk, high-reward realm of free-to-play. And for that I want to applaud not only the development team but also Ubisoft leadership for taking that chance!

Free-to-play, in particular, is a long journey. Many free-to-play games take a long time to find their footing and become profitable. Itâs a long journey that Ubisoft and the teams working on the game were prepared to make until very recently. But unfortunately, the journey became too much to sensibly continue.

I am, of course, heartbroken to have to be writing this post. Yes, this game has been a personal passion for me for years and yes, I know that not all challenges lead to victory, but I also want to recognize all of the developers who are being affected by this closure. Each and every one of them is a real person with a real life separate from our own and they have all put so much of their own passion into making this game. And I hope that they can be proud of what they did achieve. I know that I will always be proud and grateful to have worked with such a great team! A team that really punched above its weight class.

And what they achieved is truly remarkable. The early response from players when XDefiant launched was amazingâwe broke internal records for the fastest game to surpass five million users and in the end we had over 15 million players play our game! That is something to be extremely proud of, especially considering how tough this genre is. So, thank you to all of the developers who put their passion into making this game!

If thereâs one thing, I hope we can all take away from this experience, itâs the importance of open, honest communication between developers and players. This âplayer-firstâ mentality along with respectful, non-toxic conversations between developers and players has been one of the standout differences that made XDefiant so special. From my very first post about XDefiant, this was the vision I wanted to champion, and I hope it leaves a positive mark on how the game industry treats its players and communities.

To our players, THANK YOU! From the bottom of my heart, I want to express my deepest gratitude for the incredible community that has grown around XDefiant. Your passion, creativity, and dedication have inspired us every step of the way.

With the utmost of love and respect,
Mark Rubin, Executive Producer

item.title: SD Gundam G Generation ETERNAL network test set for January 23 to 28, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/sd-gundam-g-generation-eternal-network-test-set-for-january-23-to-28-2025

Bandai Namco has opened sign-ups for a network test for SD Gundam G Generation ETERNAL, the May 2022-announced RPG for iOS and Android. Sign-ups are available until January 7, 2025, and the test will run from January 23 to 28 across the United States, Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. 1,500 users from the United States will be accepted.

The network test will feature the following content:

â  Available Content in the Network Test

Main Stages

Immerse yourself in the universe of Gundam by playing a portion of stages featuring content from:

  • Mobile Suit Gundam
  • Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam: A New Translation
  • Mobile Suit Gundam SEED

The Mobile Suit Gundam SEED stage will be available after the third day.

Form Your Very Own Squad and Experience the Dynamic Battle Animations!

  • Squad Formation â You can form your own unique squad from a wide variety of units and characters.
  • Combat â Sortie in the Network Testâs grid-based battlefield stages and command your units to enjoy the gameplay the G Generation series is known for.
  • Battle Animations â Enjoy stunning animations during battles, with quality comparable to the console G Generation series.

Upgrade and Develop Various Units and Train Characters

  • Upgrade â You can upgrade your units and train your characters.
  • Development â Add your upgraded units to the development list and use âDevelopâ to create a brand-new unit.

High-Difficulty Event âFierce Enemy Assaultâ

Obtain SSR units by challenging strong enemies in Enemy Raid. Plus, you can even limit break the reward unit by repeatedly playing the stages.

Base

The base contains various functions that the player can make use of.

  • Warship Cruise â You can receive useful items for game progression at regular intervals.
  • Character Request â You can receive rewards for completing the equests given by characters.

Also, you can display and view MS Dock Units that can be obtained by clearing the main stages.

Upgrade Stage

Obtain tons of Capital and upgrade materials in the Upgrade Stage! For each material, there is a limit to the number of times you can play per day.

Bandai Namco also published the fourth âETERNAL Transmissionâ developer log with additional information.

Watch a new trailer below.

Network Test Announce Trailer

Japanese

Korean

Traditional Chinese

Simplified Chinese

item.title: Attack on Titan VR: Unbreakable launches December 17
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/attack-on-titan-vr-unbreakable-launches-december-17

  • Quest

Currently in Early Access.

Attack on Titan VR: Unbreakable will leave Early Access and launch for Quest 2 and 3 via Meta Store on December 17, developer UNIVRS announced.

When it launches, Part 1 (the Early Access version) will increase in price from $4.99 to $7.99, and Part will be priced at $12. A âComplete Editionâ including both parts will be available for $19.99.

âAfter the Early Access launch, weâve received overwhelmingly passionate support from our Discord community to improve Attack on Titan VR: Unbreakable,â said UNIVRS CEO Keigo Fujikawa in a press release. âWe canât wait to bring these changes to the game upon launch and make it an unforgettable gameplay experience all players have been waiting for.â

Here is an overview of the game, via UNIVRS:

Join fellow Scout Regiment soldiers for the final two chapters of this epic saga added in Part 2. Take on towering terrors with a friend in the new two-player Co-op Mode, and work together to save humanity with new weapons and stages. Additional content is planned including Survival Mode and Global Challenge (limited-time event), where players worldwide can work together to unlock the new weapon âThunder Spear.â

Jump onto the frontline and engage in aerial combat against the Titan invasion. Soar above the skyline with Omni-Directional Mobility (ODM) Gear and scout for oncoming threats between districts. Master the blade alongside other regiment soldiers and help save civilians from the Titansâ assault.

Choose from a catalog of distinct blade types and leap into battle. Race against time, evading incoming attacks while securing supply drops and guarding command outposts. Accrue points to earn stars to unlock upgraded weapons with specific buffs.

Become fully immersed while zipping across the districts of the inner Walls. Chop down the limbs of tyrannical Titans, target their weak points on the nape of their neck, finishing them off with speed and accuracy. Fight for the human race alongside fan-favorite Attack on Titan characters, reprised by the original cast of English and Japanese voice actors.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Release Date Trailer

English

Japanese

Screenshots
